comments:
AK (2/9/01 12:23:53 PM)	
		1. try to create a class called "AUX"
			you get the walkback below
		 
		 there are some file names in windows that behave differently than others: "aux" is one example

		2. quite naturally, even a class file cannot be called aux so this kills the workbench too:
			a cu named Fred.java
			class AUX{}
			you get a BIG walkback when trying to build

		3. _anything_ you do that can create any file with this name causes a walkback (that is, renaming a cu, a top-level class etc.)

		4. btw, the workbench gets totally unstable when you do 2. (cannot even really close it)

NOTES:

DB (09.02.2001 17:17:03)
	The only thing I see we can do is to check whether we are running on Windows and then issue an error
	if the user tries to create a file named aux. Or we forbid aux as a filename for Unix too.

	What's about other invalid filename like com /dev/nul on Windows or /dev/null on unix

AK (3/13/01 6:41:45 PM)
	see also: 1GAJ8GY: ITPJUI:WINNT - 'con' is a magic name

EG (3/14/2001 8:56:51 AM)
	we should handle this situation without crashing.

JBL (3/15/2001 12:07:59 PM)
	ICompilationUnit.createType(...) specifies that it throws a JavaModelException if the type could not be created.
	The NewClassCreationWizard should not print this stack trace to the console and should handle it more gracefuly.
	Moving back to ITPJUI.

MA (21.03.2001 09:16:46)
	I removed the stack trace, which was still there for debugging reasons.
	I suggest we discourage naming classes to the win/unix keywords.
	We could add these check to the routines 	JavaConventions.validateTypeName.
	This could be too strict as having it as as enclosed type might be ok with such a name (?)

EG (3/21/01 10:00:38 AM)
	We should try to create and see what the platform does. We should not hard code such
	assumptions in the code.

MA (21.03.2001 14:55:47)
	It would just be a warning (discourage).

PA (28.05.01 12:37:41)
	this problem is not fixed.
	tried to make a class called "AUX" -> eclipse did not come back again.
	had to shutdown eclipse, no error trace in the log.
	build 113
platform should provide a method to check for illegal names.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 3041 ***
